Name: Aden
Description: A historic port city and the temporary capital of Yemen, Aden has been a vital center for trade and culture for centuries.

Name: Al Hudaydah
Description: Located on the western coast, Al Hudaydah is a key port and a hub for Yemen s fishing industry.

Name: Al Mahwit
Description: A mountainous governorate located west of Sanaa, known for its agriculture and traditional Yemeni culture.

Name: Abyan
Description: A coastal governorate in the south of Yemen, Abyan is known for its agricultural lands and beaches along the Arabian Sea.

Name: Al Bayda
Description: A governorate located in the central highlands of Yemen, known for its agriculture and historical significance.

Name: Al Dhalee
Description: Located in the southern part of Yemen, Al Dhalee is known for its agriculture and fertile plains.

Name: Amran
Description: A governorate located north of Sanaa, Amran is known for its mountains, agriculture, and traditional Yemeni architecture.

Name: Dhamar
Description: Located to the south of Sanaa, Dhamar is known for its fertile lands and agricultural output.

Name: Hadhramaut
Description: A vast and historically significant region in eastern Yemen, Hadhramaut is known for its rich history, culture, and the desert environment.

Name: Hajjah
Description: A governorate located in the northern part of Yemen, Hajjah is known for its agricultural activities, particularly wheat and barley production.

Name: Ibb
Description: A governorate in central Yemen, Ibb is known for its lush green mountains and its agricultural output, particularly in terms of fruits and vegetables.

Name: Al Jawf
Description: Located in the northeastern part of Yemen, Al Jawf is known for its desert landscape and historical sites.

Name: Lahij
Description: Lahij is located in southern Yemen and is known for its beaches and agricultural activities, especially in date palm farming.

Name: Marib
Description: Located in the east of Yemen,  Marib is known for its historical significance and ancient archaeological sites, along with oil and gas production.

Name: Raymah
Description: A governorate in western Yemen, Raymah is characterized by its mountainous terrain and agricultural activity.

Name: Sanaa
Description: The capital governorate, Sanaa is known for its rich history, ancient architecture, and is the political, cultural, and economic heart of Yemen.

Name: Shabwah
Description: A governorate in the southeastern part of Yemen, Shabwah is rich in oil resources and desert landscapes.

Name: Socotra
Description: A unique archipelago located in the Arabian Sea, Socotra is famous for its biodiversity and its distinctive flora and fauna.

Name: Taiz
Description: Taiz is located in the southwestern part of Yemen and is an important cultural and economic center.
